data.title: Lighting effects do not work on iOS
MonoGame on AGENT Watch
data.body: Yes I'm nuts but I'm working on porting MonoGame to the AGENT watch :)

data.title: Texture2D: Fix OpenGL GetData with null Rect
data.body:
In the current Texture2D.GetData, we create a temp array for the texture data even when we do not need to. In the case where we don't need to, the `data` value is reassigned to the temp reference. This isn't entirely efficient, and can cause problems in certain cases (Capsized crashes after attempting to pass the newly obtained Texture2D data to FarseerPhysicsXNA's PolygonCreationAssistance class).

This revision adjusts the GetTexImage call to use `data` directly if `rect` has no value, so we always write our result to the original array.

data.title: Update the XNA Framework Dispatcher on WP8
data.body:
Update the XNA Framework Dispatcher as it is required to raise some events.

More info:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.frameworkdispatcher.update.aspx

data.title: Load custom content types using reflection
data.body: WP8 and Android need this to reload custom content types properly.

data.title: 2MGFX (specifically MojoShader) cannot handle tex2Dlod in vertex shaders.
Updated For #1604
data.body: Conflict resolution, changes per Tom Spilman and then undo some changes to get further along in the launch path on the simulator. The BasicEffect does not support textures yet from what I can tell when we ran the cocos2d-xna test application against it.

data.title: Update of PR 1603
data.body: I added @CartBlanche changes and added a check on a null reference that always seemed to happen when I ran my tests on PSM.

data.title: Improvement pack for monogame.
data.body:
Full list of changes.
-Position property to MouseState - because its useful.
-Indexers to Matrix - in special cases such when using internet templates or examples from C++ its useful.
-Operators to Point - because why not ? - this is useful in many scenario. I think XNA developers just forget about it.
-Few overloads of Contains method to Rectangle - im found it useful.
-Simple code normalization - such as moving Matrix.Decompose to good place.

PS These changes will make my experience of monogame more beauty. I hope for others too.

data.title: Remove CompilerOptions.cs
data.body:
Remove this file....

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/CompilerOptions.cs

That is old XNA 3.1 stuff!

data.title: Texture2D width/height should be private, not protected.
data.body:
width & height fields on Texture2D are not accessible from Inherited classes on XNA.
On monogame they are marked as protected which means that anyone inherit from Texture2D/RenderTarget2D can modify it.

data.title: GameComponent.GraphicsDevice
data.body: GameComponent exposes a public GraphicsDevice property which is not available on XNA.

data.title: Texture2D FromStream works fine w/o the DX specific version.
data.body:
Texture2D FromStream(GraphicsDevice graphicsDevice, Stream stream)

the DirectX version crashes with "Not Implemented".  But it works fine if you allow it to goto the "#else".

data.title: Implement GraphicsDevice.Adapter
data.body:
This adds the Adapter property to the GraphicsDevice.

MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.graphicsdevice.adapter.aspx

This changes the code a bit in a couple places, but the behavior should be the same. MonoGame currently assumes that we will always use the DefaultAdapter, but this may not be the case later on.

data.title: Pr 1613 updated
data.body: The extra whitespace in the csproj files was the result of a conflict area on a line that had incorrect line endings.

data.title: IGameComponent.Initialize() should be called during Game.Initialize()
data.body:
On XNA , the Initialize method is called by the base Game.Initialize() for components already in the Components collection. 
See XNA sample at http://sdrv.ms/17Vvjlk 
For components that are added that,  the Initiliaze() should be called explicitly after creating the component. 

Monogame on the other hand calls Initialize() every time a component is added in the Components collection.

Problem #1) If someone removes a component and then adds it again, the initialization reoccurs (memory leaks, etc).
Problem #2) If someone creates a component on a later time he needs to call  initialize by hand before adding it to the Components (to be functional on XNA). Code ported to monogame will cause initialization twice.

For now I would recommend to use a isInitialized variable on every component to avoid any problems.

data.title: Add MSADPCMToPCM support to SoundEffectReader (non-DirectX)
data.body:
This adds MSADPCM wavedata support to non-DirectX platforms.

While platforms that use DXSharp can just run this data natively (and they do, as seen in the code above these diffs), we need to decode this on other platforms. While not as ideal as a streamed decoder, this is the best we've got until MonoGame has some sort of internal streaming system to pass various types of audio data.

This is similar to the previous addition of MSADPCM support for WaveBanks, found here:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/WaveBank.cs#L435

data.title: Fix comparison of null DisplayModes.
data.body:
This fixes a bug where comparing with one or more null DisplayModes would cause a NullReferenceException.

This also allows us to do deliberate null checks like `if (myMode == null)`.

data.title: MediaPlayer: ActiveSongChanged
data.body:
This adds MediaPlayer.ActiveSongChanged to the MonoGame MediaPlayer.

MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.media.mediaplayer.activesongchanged.aspx

As you can see, there is no real documentation aside from the statement that this variable exists. You'll notice that both Invoke() calls pass `null` for both parameters; since the MediaPlayer itself is static, and there are no documented EventArgs for this EventHandler, I can only assume that neither are actually used (and to date, no XNA game I've ported so far as used either parameter).

If someone has more information on this that'd be great, but as far as I know this is XNA4-compliant.

data.title: Missing project subtype error when creating content pipeline project plus 1 more error
data.body:
I'm receiving a strange error when I create a project using the content pipeline template that comes installed with the MonoGame 3.0.1 installer. I'm using Visual Studio Express Desktop on Windows 8 64 bit. Here's the error:

"A problem was encountered creating the sub project 'StillHavenContent'. The project file 'C:\Users\Omniverse\AppData\Local\Temp\q2f3kald.duw\Temp\StillHavenContent.csproj' cannot be opened.

There is a missing project subtype.
Subtype: '{6D335F3A-9D43-41b4-9D22-F6F17C4BE596}' is unsupported by this installation."

I should say to that I tried creating the same project on a trial version of Visual Studio Premium but it spit this error at me:

"Windows is not a supported platform in this version of XNA Game Studio, or this edition of Visual Studio. The project may not build or launch as expected."

I don't have XNA installed so I really don't understand why this is happening. Err wait a sec, when I installed the windows phone 8 SDK it installed something for XNA. Could that be the reason why?

data.title: Garbage Free GraphicsDevice.GetRenderTargets()
LOD bias setting removed from OpenGL ES 2.0 platforms.
data.body: LOD bias is not supported by glTexParameter in OpenGL ES 2.0.

data.title: DynamicSoundEffectInstance
data.body:
Implementation of DynamicSoundEffectInstance based on XAudio2 of
SharpDX. It's currently only implemented in the WP project but
could/should be migrated to the Windows 8 project as well.
As I couldn't find any unit tests on the Audio part of MonoGame I
performed a manual test by using the library in a separate WP8 MonoGame
project. It ran as expected.

data.title: OUYA start button workaround
data.body:
Due to the recent firmware update, the OnKeyUp and OnKeyDown events for KeyCode.Menu are both being sent in a single frame. This stops MonoGame's GamePad implementation from ever registering the Start button as being pressed.

This workaround can be removed if the OUYA firmware is ever updated to send these events in different frames.

data.title: Fixed black mipmap levels in DXT textures (DirectX) - Issue #1783.
data.body:
This pull request fixes a bug were the last two mipmap levels of DXT textures are black in DirectX. See also Issue #1783.
It also adds support for SamplerState.MipMapLevelOfDetailBias in OpenGL (which I used for testing).

This was tested on Windows desktop (DirectX and OpenGL) and Windows Store.
We have tested several textures types: 
- Color/DXT1/DXT5
- power-of-two vs. non-power-of-two
- DXT and mipmaps generated by XNA vs. DXT and mipmaps generated by the DirectX Texture Tool

--> No more DXT problems found in DirectX.

data.title: Weird flickering rectangle (640x480) from 0,0.
data.body:
I apologize if this has been posted before. I couldn't find it.

I am having a weird issue where the screen will flicker. A fixed size rectangle from 0,0.

Attached, a screenshot. (It flickers really fast, hence only partially purple).

It's not an issue once the game has loaded and the first GraphicsDevice.Clear() occurs.

But at launch, it will show a white rectangle for about half a second, which is annoying.

The screenshots shows the inside being 640x480. If no GraphicsDevice.Clear() is called, it will be purple flickering black/purple/black/etc. At launch it is white (against black).

I assume it's some odd OpenGL bug. I've used XNA quite a bit and can't reproduce it there. Only with MonoGame.

I am using MonoGameInstaller-3.0.1, on Windows 7 (up to date), with a Radeon 7800 (drivers up to date afaik)

This occurs with a blank project as well. I've also tried to start fullscreen, same deal. 

Let me know if I can provide further information.

![weird flickering](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/9749/658287/93fc612a-d5cf-11e2-970b-ed01d6a51941.png)

data.title: Binding for OUYA Button?
data.body: Is there a button binding in `GamePad` for the OUYA button (single press)? I expected `BigButton` to work, but it does not.
